name: mango queries/cloudant query
description: if there's no reduce function you probably don't need a couch view

name: SWR
description: SWR provides a lightweight way of fetching data in React apps compared to other solutions like React Query.

name: Hosted Login UI
description: Bundling login into our apps via @conqa/login increases page size and rolling out updates to the login experience requires multiple changes across our applications. Solutions like Cognito Hosted UI don't have these issues and it could improve our login security and user experience.

name: Ramda
description: A lot of use of Ramda at CONQA has lead to difficult-to-understand code and library updates often remove features leading to multiple versions of Ramda being bundled in apps.

name: moment.js
description: Moment is now a legacy project in maintenance mode. Prefer date-fns.

name: Accelerate Metrics
description: UI state is not the same as server state and these things should be separate as discussed in this podcast.

name: CouchDB
description: prefer AWS managed offereings, e.g. DynamoDB

name: Redux
description: if possible use Redux Toolkkitl or try to just use React;

name: Cerebral
description: EOL, newer versions of React provide features like hooks, for older versions of React Redux might be appropriate

name: Redux Saga
description: Does not work well with TypeScript
